REUTERS.UNKNOWN: RM f1008 reute u f BC-SPANISH-MONEY-SUPPLY 04-13 0088

TEXT.TITLE: SPANISH MONEY SUPPLY GROWING AT DOUBLE TARGET PACE
TEXT.BODY: Spain's principal measure of money supply, the broad-based liquid assets in public hands (ALP), grew at an annualised rate of 17.6 pct in March against 16.6 pct in February and 19.6 pct in March last year, provisional Bank of Spain figures show. The bank's target range for this year is 6.5 to 9.5 pct, and Bank of Spain Governor Mariano Rubio said this month he was aiming for the lower end of that range. ALP grew by 11.4 pct during 1986. REUTER
